intro: Seidenfia seychellarum, commonly known as the Seychelles spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles archipelago. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and often milky sap. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish flowers. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to the island's tropical climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
